hero.name: Marwan Ahmed Awny Elagha
hero.title: Candidate of the Arab Republic of Egypt for the Arab Scout Committee – Youth Advisors

cv.title: About Me
cv.content:
Marwan is an Egyptian legal professional with published work in International Law and Middle East Studies. He currently practices law in Egypt with ADSERO Ragy Soliman & Partners (Technology, Media, and Telecommunications practice group). He has over three years of experience providing consultancy to the Egyptian Government and the Arab Scout Region on matters of international law, public policy, and youth diplomacy, qualifying him to offer effective advice to the Arab Scout Committee and the Arab National Scout Organizations.

Marwan has been dedicated to the Scout Movement since 2008, starting as a Cub Scout with the esteemed Elsalam Scout Groups. He has represented Egypt and the Arab Scout Region at dozens of international and regional events, including the 43rd World Scout Conference, the 24th World Scout Jamboree (USA), the 30th Arab Scout Jamboree, the Kandersteg International Scout Centre's Centenary in Switzerland, and the tenth anniversary celebration of Messengers of Peace in Saudi Arabia. His involvement also extends to the Arab Scout Forum for Young Media Professionals and JOTA-JOTI from 2010 to 2025.

He is a recipient of the Lord Baden-Powell Fellowship from the World Scout Foundation, the Messengers of Peace Heroes Award from the World Organization of the Scout Movement (presented at the 73rd UN General Assembly in New York), and the World Scout Environment Badge. From Egypt, he holds the 2nd Class Courage Order, the General Service Order, the Volunteering Order, and the Badge of Merits, in addition to being named the Outstanding Student at the Egyptian University level (2023/2024). Marwan is also a member of the KISC General Assembly in Switzerland, the Egyptian Red Crescent, and serves as the President of the Rotaract El Tahrir Club (Rotary Egypt, 2025/2026). He is a founding member of the Egyptian Scout Archive since 2020 and a co-author of a published work on the history of Egyptian Scouting philatelic stamps.
